intro: Stenoloma gracile, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered spikelets that bear tiny flowers. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as marshes and wetlands. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces wind-pollinated flowers, typical of many sedges. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and small aquatic organisms.
